com.percussion.cms.objectstore
Class PSProcessorCommon

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSProcessorCommon
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSComponentProcessor, com.percussion.cms.objectstore.IPSKeyGenerator
public abstract class PSProcessorCommon
extends Object
implements IPSComponentProcessor, com.percussion.cms.objectstore.IPSKeyGenerator

This is the base class for a set of processors that use applications to perform their work. This class performs various processing work that is independent of how the data is submitted to the server. It calls various doXXX methods passing in the resource name and the processed data. This class manages the configuration properties and passes on the appropriate ones.

The following properties must be specified in the processor config.

Property name Description Required? Type
deleteResource The partial URL of the app and resource that can delete components of the associated type, in the format "app/resource.xml". The keys for all the components to be loaded will be included as multiple html params. An html param for each key part is created for each key. For example, if you have 2 simple keys whose part is "ID", the html param "ID" will appear twice, e.g., ID=3&ID=4. required standard
saveResource The parital URL of the app and resource that can insert and update components of the associated type, in the format "app/resource.xml". The supplied document will have a root element whose name is that supplied in the 'rootElementName' property. Each child of this element will be the element returned from the toDbXml method of the associated component type. Keys will be included in the input document for inserts. required standard
loadResource The partial URL of the app and resource that can supply an xml document that contains serialized versions of the requested component type, in the format "app/resource.xml". Each child of the returned document will eventually be supplied to the fromXml method of a component of the type requested. The keys for all the components to be loaded will be included as multiple html params. An html param for each key part is created for each key. For example, if you have 2 simple keys whose part is "ID", the html param "ID" will appear twice, e.g., ID=3&ID=4. The system may also request all objects of this type by not including any keys. The implementor will typically handle this by making 2 resources with the same name and adding selection criteria based on the presence of the key. One of the apps will use a native select using an IN clause, and the PrepareInClause exit. The other one is a simple selector w/ no WHERE clauses. required standard
relationshipResource The partial URL of the app and resource that will be used when processing relationship changes such as insert, update and deletes. e.g., rx_ceArticle/article.xml?command=relation required standard
rootElementName The name of the doc element that will wrap the component xml, both for loading and saving. required standard
compTable The name of the table containing these components. Required for deleting if deleteResource not supplied, or for re-ordering support. maybe standard
sequenceCol The name of the column containing the sort-rank value. Required for deleting if deleteResource not supplied, or for re-ordering support. maybe standard
keyCol The name of the column containing the primary key. Required for deleting if deleteResource not supplied, or for re-ordering support. maybe standard
required standard

Version:
1.0
Author:
Paul Howard

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

PSProcessorCommon

protected PSProcessorCommon()
Default consructor

PSProcessorCommon

protected PSProcessorCommon(Map props)
Constructor that stores the supplied props for later use. Implementors should not instantiate this class directly.

Parameters:
props - The set of required and optional properties for all component types, as specified in the class description. Each entry in the map has a String (component type) as the key and Map, as the value. Each map entry has a String key and String (standard property) or Element (custom property) value.

Properties come in 1 of 2 flavors, standard or custom. Standard properties are stored in the collection as Strings, custom properties as Elements. Never null. Missing properties will not be discovered until an operation is activated. A ref to this map is stored in this instance for later use, the map and the collections it contains are never modified by this class.

All key names should be lowercased to allow case-insensitive compares.

Method Detail

save

public PSSaveResults save(IPSDbComponent[] components)
                   throws PSCmsException
See interface for general description.

More specifically, this class performs the following steps:

  1. Get the component type from the component, if the type cannot be found in the props, or any required props are missing, an exception is thrown.
  2. Call toDbXml and create a document whose root element name was supplied in the props.
  3. Call the derived class to perform the actual save.
  4. If successful, call setPersisted on the components.

Specified by:
save in interface IPSComponentProcessor
Parameters:
components - The component(s) that need to be inserted or updated. The states of the supplied components will be checked first; any with DBSTATE_UNMODIFIED will be skipped. Never null. Any null entries will be skipped. The component type is obtained by calling getComponentType() on the elements. The type name is then used to find the processor properties in the config data. If an entry cannot be found, an exception is thrown.
Returns:
A set of components equivalent to the ones supplied (they may or may not be the exact ones supplied, depending on the processor) where each one will return true for isPersisted. You will get back the same component if it was unmodified when supplied. The returned components are not necessarily in the same order as when they were supplied. This object also contains statistics specifying how many components were saved or deleted.
Throws:
PSCmsException - If the processor for the supplied type is not found or cannot be instantiated, or any problems occur while getting the data.

doSave

protected PSProcessingStatistics doSave(String resourceName,
                                        Document input)
                                 throws PSCmsException
Derived classes add the communication to the server.

Parameters:
resourceName - Never null or empty. The name of the Rhythmyx resource in the format "appName/resourceName.xml". A query string is allowed.
input - The document ready to send to the specified resource. Never null.
Throws:
PSCmsException - If the save can't be performed for any reason, including authorization.

load

public Element[] load(String componentType,
                      PSKey[] locators)
               throws PSCmsException
See interface for general description.

More specifically, this class performs the following steps:

  1. Use the supplied componentType to find the required props to perform load. If the type cannot be found in the props, or any required props are missing, an exception is thrown.
  2. If successful, extract each element and assign it to the correct index in the Element array. If an Element is not found for a requested key, set that Element entry to null.
  3. For every key successfully loaded, set the persisted state of the key to true.

Specified by:
load in interface IPSComponentProcessor
Parameters:
componentType - The base class name of the component being processed. Never empty or null. If the name is not found in the config, an exception is thrown.
locators - References to existing objects which you wish to re-serialize. All entries must be of the same type. If an entry cannot be found for a key, no Element will be returned. If the size of the returned array is less than the # of keys supplied, it is the responsibility of the caller to determine which keys were skipped because an object could not be found. If null, all objects of the requested type are returned. If any entry is null, an exception is thrown.
Returns:
An array with 0 or more xml fragments, each appropriate to populate an instance of the component whose name was supplied. An entry will be null if the supplied key does not reference an object of the specified type.
Throws:
PSCmsException - If the processor for the supplied type is not found or cannot be instantiated, or any problems occur while getting the data.

doLoad

protected Document doLoad(String resourceName,
                          Map ids)
                   throws PSCmsException
Derived classes do the real work here.

Parameters:
resourceName - Never null or empty. The name of the Rhythmyx resource in the format "appName/resourceName.xml". A query string is allowed.
ids - Never null. Each entry is a pair whose key is a String and value is an String[]. The key is the name of the primary key part, while the value contains all desired ids for that key part. May be empty, indicating all instances are desired.
Returns:
A document with 1 or more serialized components. null if no components were located.
Throws:
PSCmsException - If the save can't be performed for any reason, including authorization.

doDelete

protected int doDelete(String resourceName,
                       Map ids)
                throws PSCmsException
Derived classes do the real work here.

Parameters:
resourceName - Never null or empty. The name of the Rhythmyx resource in the format "appName/resourceName.xml". A query string is allowed.
ids - Never null. Each entry is a pair whose key is a String and value is an String[]. The key is the name of the primary key part, while the value contains all desired ids for that key part. May be empty, indicating all instances are desired.
Returns:
The number of components deleted.
Throws:
PSCmsException - If the delete can't be performed for any reason, including authorization.

delete

public int delete(String componentType,
                  PSKey[] locators)
           throws PSCmsException
See interface for general description.

More specifically, this class performs the following steps for each group of similar keys:

  1. Use the supplied componentType to find the required props to perform delete. If the type cannot be found in the props, or any required props are missing, an exception is thrown.
  2. If a deleteResource is supplied, for each key, create an html parameter whose name is the name of the key part. The # of instances of this param will be set based on how many keys are provided.
  3. If not supplied, then the compTable and sequenceCol and keyCol must be provided. In this case, cascading deletes are implemented using code and the foreign key relationships that exist in the db.

Specified by:
delete in interface IPSComponentProcessor
Parameters:
componentType - The value returned by the getComponentType method of the component being processed. Never empty or null. If the name is not found in the config, an exception is thrown.
locators - References to existing objects which you wish to permanently remove from the system. If an entry cannot be found for a key, that key is skipped and processing continues normally. If null is found in the array, it is skipped and no error is reported.

You can determine which keys were skipped (if any) by calling the isAssigned method; it will return false for all successful deletes.

Returns:
The number of components actually deleted.
Throws:
PSCmsException - If the processor for the supplied type is not found or cannot be instantiated, or any problems occur while removing the data.

delete

public int delete(IPSDbComponent[] comps)
           throws PSCmsException
See interface for general description. This method marks all supplied comps for deletion, then sends them to the save method.

Specified by:
delete in interface IPSComponentProcessor
Parameters:
comps - The component(s) that need to be removed. The states of the supplied components will be checked first; any with unpersisted keys will be skipped. Never null and no entry may be null. The component type is obtained by calling getComponentType() on the entries. The type name is then used to find the processor properties in the config data. If an entry cannot be found, an exception is thrown.
Returns:
The number of components actually deleted.
Throws:
PSCmsException - If the processor for any of the types is not found or cannot be instantiated, or any problems occur while removing the data.

doAllocateIds

protected int[] doAllocateIds(String lookup,
                              int count)
                       throws PSCmsException
The derived class does the real work here. Must allocate a block of numbers from the NextNumber table, using the supplied lookup as the key.

Parameters:
lookup - Assumed not null.
count - Assumed > 0;
Returns:
An array with 0 or more entries.
Throws:
PSCmsException - If any problems while allocating the ids.
